result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kha Lit not in court.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
State makes appearance for the record. This matter was previously attached to Case Number 15CF3366. The findings were not entered into CCAP in this case.  The matter was heard on 7/28/2016. The entry should have been as follows:

The Court found that the defendant is not competent and not likely to become competent within the statutorily allowed time.

Parties review report dated  6-27-2016 submitted by Dr. Garcia. State does not challenge the report.  Defendant does not wish to challenge the report.  Parties stipulate that the Court may use the Doctor's Report as a factual basis.  Based upon the doctor's report and statements of the parties, the Court finds that the defendant is not competent to proceed and is not likely to regain competency within the statutorily allowed time.  Upon Petition for Conversion filed by the Assistant District Attorney, Court orders the proceedings converted to proceedings under Ch. 51, Stats., and the criminal complaint, statements of witnesses, transcripts and forensic evaluation reports shall serve as a law enforcement officer's statement of emergency detention under s. 51.15, Stats.  Court further ordered the criminal proceedings suspended and defendant remanded to the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff, who shall immediatly convey defendant to New Beginnings AFH, an emergency protective placement facility where defendant shall be held for proceedings under 51.15, 51.45(11) or 55.135, Wis. Stats., where he shall receive a psychiatric evaluation within 24 hours of admission to determine whether he is a proper subject for commitment under Ch. 51 or emergency protective placement under Ch. 55.  Order of Conversion signed and filed.

Order of Conversion to Civil Commitment Proceedings Under 971.14(6) Wis. Stats. and Emergency Detention Statement, signed, filed and distributed.

Attorney Robert E Haney in court, defendant Kha Lit not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Parties stipulate to the findings of the doctor's report dated 4-15-2016.  Therefore, the Court finds that the defendant is not competent to proceed and not likely to become competent to proceed and the statutorily authorized time limit to regain competency has expired.  Pursuant to 971.14(6)(a), the Court discharged the defendant from the commitment to the Department of Health and Family Services, and ordered to appear for a redetermination.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Robert E Haney in court, defendant Kha Lit not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court for Return on Doctor's report, case heard off the record.  Parties in receipt of Dr. Garcia's report dated April 15, 2016.  Parties request a status conference date.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kha Lit in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Kha Lit in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for competency hearing. Sworn for the State: Dr. Hernke.  Sworn for the defense: the defendant. Exhibit 1 received. Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.   Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 38.

Exhibit list received and filed.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Kha Lit in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Kha Lit in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Simon Koko.  
Report of Dr. Hernke is reviewed by all parties.  The defendant is challenging the finding and requests a hearing.  Defense counsel is in agreement with the report.  The court will set a hearing for 11-9-2015 at 11:00am; Dr. Hernke and interpreter are available.
for Competency Examination by DHS signed and filed.

Defendant Kha Lit in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Kha Lit in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as BURMESE interpreter:  Simon Koko.
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.     Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Clerk contacted the Forensic Unit to arrange for date and time for defendant to be examined at the House of Correction with interpreter Koko present.  Scheduled appointment is 10-30-2015 at 8:30am.  Return of report is set for 11-6-2015 at 8:15 in Branch 38.
The court will vacate all trial dates.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.
